page.title: 05HOUSING - PETWORTH RURAL NE
page.content: Hawkhurst Court, once a private school in 32 acres, is now a private estate of 27 units. Each is being converted to its new owner's requirements without destroying the character of the original structures. The main building is now four 'townhouses', each having part of the grounds behind as garden. The outbuildings and lodges have been split into varying sizes, and prices of these dwellings range from #58,000 to #183,000. These are freehold properties. Some of the new owners were staff at the school, but there is a mixed age range on the estate, some families having children. All these dwellings have modern facilities, of course, and double glazing. A paddock of 20 acres is expected to fetch between #2,500 and #3,000 an acre as agricultural land.
